Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; below, in handle zone, black-figure battle scene; from left: part of warrior to left with spear raised in right hand (helmet with added red crest support and incised decoration on crest, short chiton, cuirass with red splotch below raised arm, red on scabbard and red on rim of shield); upper part of warrior facing right but probably fleeing left (red on cap and double crest of helmet, incised lines on crest; round shield with device of whirligig of five wings, red on central boss and inner feathers and red dots on rim), spear raised in right hand; heads, necks and shoulders of pair of horses to left (teeth in added white on near horse).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.37)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 269-270, no. 54)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 393, no. B571)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 233, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0471) (Phase 1)
Heesen 2011 / Athenian Little-Master Cups (p. 284 no. 221, pl. 62e)
